summary: This is an email chain from September 2019 among federal prosecutors and investigators discussing the scheduling of interviews with individuals at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in relation to the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death. It references coordination with the Office of the Inspector General (OIG) and an attorney representing a witness.

persons.name: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the initial email requesting coordination of interviews with MCC personnel for the following week, regarding the Epstein death investigation.

events.title: Attorney Contact for Epstein Death Investigation
events.description: A prosecutor mentions hearing from a lawyer (representing a witness) who is ready to meet regarding the Epstein death investigation, proposing meeting times for the following week.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

events.title: Follow-up on Outstanding MCC Interviews
events.description: Email follow-up inquiring if interviews with MCC personnel ever occurred, noting that agents may not have responded and proposing to check for a date the following week.
personsInvolved: Assistant United States Attorney Southern District of New York

locations: New York Field Office (Office of the Inspector General)
keyFacts: The document is part of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death in August 2019, focusing on interviews with MCC personnel.
An attorney representing a witness in the Epstein death investigation was ready to meet with prosecutors in late August 2019.
By September 11, 2019, there was uncertainty about whether planned interviews with MCC personnel had actually taken place.
The email chain involves coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY), the FBI, and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General.
The document lists five individuals for interview, with two marked as 'low priority', but all names are redacted.
